title: Boris Johnson and Osborne publish tax summaries as Cameron defends tax record - as it happened | Politics | The Guardian
summary: boris johnson publishes details of tax returns going .
skinner suspended from commons for calling cameron 'dodgy ' and refusing to retract the term .
tax havens have signed up to information-sharing measures , cameron says .
cameron says allegations about his father have been deeply hurtful and profoundly untrue ''
pickles mocks corbyn for not being able to find his tax return .

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: david cameron has used a commons statement to attempt to close down the controversy about his family finances and his involvement in an offshore fund .

he told mps that he accepted his handling of his issue last week had been flawed , but he claimed that his decision at the weekend to publish information from his tax returns for the last six years was unprecedented '' .

he spoke about his finances in some detail but sidestepped certain questions - most notably one from jeremy corbyn about whether any of the shares worth £ 70,000 sold by cameron in 2010 ( in addition to the blairmore holdings shares ) were held offshore .
number 10 has refused to say they confirm they were onshore .

jeremy corbyn gave a spirited response accusing cameron of failing to address wider issues of inequality , but cameron received strong support from his mps and by the end it looked as if he had pulled off a reasonably competent damage limitation exercise .

cameron told mps that , although he was calling for prime ministers , chancellors and their official opposition counterparts to publish their tax information , he did not believe it was right to enforce transparency on mps or public figures more generally .

i think there is a strong case for the prime minister and the leader of the opposition , and for the chancellor and shadow chancellor , because they are people who are or who wish to be responsible for the nation 's finances .
as for mps , we already have robust rules on members ' interests and their declaration and i believe that is the model we should continue to follow .
we should think carefully before abandoning completely all taxpayer confidentiality in this house as some have suggested .

if this were to come in for mps , people would also ask for a similar approach for those who ask us questions , those who run large public services , or lead local government , or indeed those who edit the news programmes or newspapers .
i think this would be a very big step for our country , it certainly should n't take place without a long and thoughtful debate and it is not the approach that i would recommend .
cameron said the allegations about his late father having been engaged in tax avoidance were deeply hurtful and profoundly untrue '' .
he said he was proud of his father : i know he was a hard-working man and a wonderful dad and i 'm proud of everything he did to build a business and provide for his family .
he said organisations like the bbc and the guardian have money invested offshore in funds like the one set up by his father .
describing blairmore holdings , he said : this investment fund was set up overseas in the first place because it was going to be trading predominantly in dollar securities .
so like very many other commercial investment funds it made sense to be set up inside one of the main centres of dollar trading .
there are thousands of these investment funds , and many millions of people in britain who own shares , many of whom hold them through investment funds or unit trusts .
such funds , including those listed outside the uk , are included in the pension funds of local government , most of britain 's largest companies , and indeed even some trade unions .
even a quick look shows that the bbc , the mirror group , guardian newspapers , and to one council entirely at random - islington - all have these sorts of overseas investments .
this is an entirely standard practice and it is not to avoid tax .
he said did not respond to the allegations about his investments earlier because he was angry about what was being said about his father .
i accept all of the criticisms for not responding more quickly to these issues last week but as i said i was angry about the way my father 's memory was being traduced .
corbyn said cameron did not appreciate how angry members of the public were about tax avoidance .
responding to cameron , corbyn said : may i thank you for the advance sight of your statement , it is absolutely a masterclass in the art of distraction .
i 'm sure you will join me in welcoming the outstanding journalism that has gone into exposing the scandal of destructive global tax avoidance revealed by the panama papers .
what they have driven home is what many people have increasingly felt - there is now one rule for the super-rich and another for the rest .
i 'm honestly not sure that you fully appreciate the anger that is out there over this injustice .
corbyn also published his own tax return .
labour confirmed he paid a £ 100 fine because he submitted it late .
the labour mp dennis skinner was suspended from the chamber for calling cameron dodgy dave '' .

he asked cameron : does the prime minister recall that at the time after he became prime minister under the coalition and at the time when he was dividing the nation between strivers and scroungers , i asked him a very important question about the windfall he received when he wrote off the mortgage of the premises in notting hill , and i said to him he did n't write off the mortgage of the one taxpayers were helping to pay for at oxford .
i did n't receive a proper answer then .
maybe dodgy dave will answer it now .

john bercow , the speaker , asked skinner to withdraw the word dodgy '' ( it is against parliamentary rules to use an insult like that in the chamber ) and he suspended skinner for the rest of the day when skinner refused .
cameron never answered the question .

george osborne has released a summary of his tax return for last year showing he earned almost £ 200,000 by topping up his chancellor 's salary with rental income and dividends from his family 's wallpaper firm .
sir alan duncan , the conservative former minister and former oil trader , said the commons could end up being stuffed full of low-achievers '' if mps had to publish their tax returns .

he asked cameron : should n't the prime minister 's critics really just snap out of the synthetic indignation and admit that their real point is that they hate anyone who has got a hint of wealth in them ?

may i support the prime minister in fending off those who are attacking him , particularly in thinking of this place , because if he does n't , we risk seeing a house of commons which is stuffed full of low-achievers who hate enterprise , hate people who look after their own family and know absolutely nothing about the outside world .
cameron said he did not want to discourage people with a successful careers from becoming mps .
update : duncan has just issued a clarification on twitter .
alan duncan ( @ alanduncanmp ) seems i could have been a little clearer in parliament today .

success is of course not always the same as wealth ( 1/2 ) alan duncan ( @ alanduncanmp ) my point was that we should n't discourage people who 've done well in business from entering parliament by sniping at wealth per se ( 2/2 ) cameron effectively withdrew his criticism of the comedian jimmy carr over his involvement with a tax avoidance scheme .
four years ago cameron said what carr was doing was morally wrong '' .

today he said : what i 've said before , and i 'm very happy to say again , is there are some practices of very aggressive tax avoidance that i think do merit proper questions and then legislative action .
and to be fair to jimmy carr , as soon as it was pointed out that he was in a scheme to artificially reduce his income he immediately changed his arrangements .
he made that very clear and i pay tribute to him for doing that .
sajid javid , the business secretary , has told mps the government could co-invest '' with a commercial buyer to support the port talbot steelworks .
jim pickard ( @ pickardje ) big news : sajid javid confirms possibility of `` co-investing with a buyer on commercial terms '' at port talbot .
ministers have been defeated twice in the house of lords on the housing bill .
as the press association reports , peers backed an amendment requiring repayment of the 20 % discount for starter homes on a sliding scale if sold during the first 20 years .
voting was 275 to 181 , a majority of 94 , for the amendment tabled by independent crossbencher lord best with opposition support .
and the government was defeated again over the starter home policy when peers backed a move to let local authorities decide on the proportion of such homes in new developments .
voting was 280 to 194 , a majority of 86 .
that 's all for today .
thanks for the comments .
angus robertson , the snp leader at westminster , said david cameron 's measures to crack down on tax havens did not go far enough .
he said : it is estimated that between 21 and 32 trillion dollars of private financial wealth is located , untaxed or lightly taxed , in tax havens around the world .
illicit cross-border financial flows are estimated at more than £ 1 trillion dollars per year , ten times more than global foreign aid budgets combined .
the panama papers leak is so large that if one printed the file the final document would be 650m pages long .
it is right that a special task force has been set up to go through the information that has been leaked .
hopefully charges will follow if criminality can be proven .
the public are indignant here and around the world .
people are rightly angered by the different rules for normal tax-payers and a small ultra-rich elite .
but we must ask ourselves whether the scale of the problem has been taken seriously , because quite patently it has not been thus far domestically and internationally .
the uk bears a particular responsibility given that the uk and its overseas territories collectively sit at the top of the financial secrecy index of the tax justice network .
in the commons robertson responded to cameron after andrew tyrie , but i did not include his comments earlier because i was looking at corbyn 's tax return .
this is from sky 's ed conway .
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) boris johnson earned more in 2014/15 than david cameron , george osborne , jeremy corbyn & john mcdonnell put together

documents.title: boris johnson publishes details of tax returns going
text: boris johnson , the conservative mp and mayor of london , has also published details of his tax returns , going back four years ( pdf ) .
boris johnson 's tax details of london
here is my colleague gaby hinsliff 's assessment of the statement .
gaby hinsliff ( @ gabyhinsliff ) tax debate summary : cameron cheerily unruffled , dennis skinner soon to be a meme , alan duncan possibly ditto .
world entirely unchanged .
the david cameron statement has just finished .
i will post a summary of the key points soon .

number 10 have not released the full text of what cameron said yet , but they have issued a news release about the plans to create a criminal offence for corporations who fail to stop their staff facilitating tax evasion .
cameron says his mother is developing a thicker skin '' with every week that passes .
he says we should be encouraging people to leave assets to their children , not discouraging this .

asked about today 's guardian splash saying edward troup , the head of hm revenue and customs who is overseeing the panama papers investigation , used to be a partner at simmons & simmons , the firm that acted for blairmore holdings , cameron says troup had a distinguished career in the private sector and that the fact that the public sector attracts people of this calibre is a good thing .
robert jenrick , a conservative , says he has gone back through hansard over the 13 years while labour was in power and he can not find any reference to jeremy corbyn complaining about tax havens .
he says the only relevant reference he found was corbyn saying the plan to use orders in council to take control of the turks and caicos islands in 2009 was medieval '' and extreme '' .
but corbyn is now proposing that for tax havens , he says .
cameron jokes that corbyn has now found a use of nuclear submarines ; he can send them to subjugate the isle of mann .
labour 's caroline flint says she was disappointed to hear sir alan duncan suggests that people who were not wealthy were low-achiever .
( see 4.17pm . )
as a low-achiever , she says , she wants to ask cameron if he will support moves to force companies to publish details of their tax returns .
cameron says he has always thought of flint as a high-achiever .
she put the boot in '' to his predecessor ( gordon brown ) more successfully than he did , he says .
he says the government is working to get multinationals to pay more in tax .
flint 's idea is an interesting one , but he says he does not want to make the best the enemy of the good .
cameron says some countries have complete tax disclosure .
that is not the british system , he says .
we should not give it up lightly .
labour 's wes streeting asks if cameron regrets saying in 2013 that crown dependencies and overseas territories should not be called tax havens .
cameron says that he made that statement in 2013 after those governments agreed to share some tax information with the uk .
he says the last labour government was content to let these places carry on acting as they wanted .
labour 's john mann asks if it is appropriate to claim expense to live in a grace and favour apartment while making money from renting out a home .
cameron says a member of his family went to the parliamentary commissioner for standards ' office today to respond to mann 's complaint , but found mann had not submitted it yet .
he says mann has misunderstood the arrangement .
living in downing street counts as a benefit in kind , he says .
he says he has to pay tax because that 's a taxable benefit .
labour 's alison mcgovern says mps are entitled to defend their families .
but she says she is not clear if cameron thinks it is okay to hold shares in an offshore company .
cameron says he thinks it is acceptable to hold money in an offshore unit trust .
those trusts do not hold the money for themselves ; they hold the share on behalf of the investors .
that is why many organisations have offshore investments like this .
mcgovern also asked why , if these arrangements are acceptable , he sold his shares .
cameron says that is a good question .
it was because that was the easiest way to assure people that there was no conflict of interest , he says .
here is a video from the guardian 's youtube channel showing the key exchange between david cameron and jeremy corbyn .
cameron defends the reputation of his family
the snp 's margaret ferrier asks why george osborne 's family 's wallpaper company has not paid any corporation tax for the last seven years .
cameron says osborne & little is exactly the sort of manufacturing company the government should be encouraging .
he says he is glad it is now paying a dividend .
as for its tax affairs , that should be a private matter between a company and hm revenue and customs .
the conservative mp jake berry says he would like to see tony blair 's tax returns .

dominic grieve , the conservative former attorney general , asks cameron to invited corbyn to write to him explaining exactly how cameron is supposed to have done anything illegal or improper or against the rules of the house .
because it was not clear from corbyn 's statement , grieve says .
cameron says , having had to listen to corbyn , he does not want to have to read a letter from him .
caroline lucas , the green mp , asks cameron to defend his decision to lobby the eu to water down its plans for a transparency crackdown .
cameron says lucas is wrong to think that was an eu initiative .
it was actually a british proposal .
but he was advised that , to get agreement , it was best to exclude trusts .
labour 's yvette cooper asks cameron to confirm that he and george osborne benefited from the reduction of the top rate of tax from 50 % to 45 % .
cameron says his tax details are now a matter of record .
( that 's a yes , but he can not bring himself to say so explicitly . )
he says after the top rate was cut to 45 % , revenue from top-rate payers actually went up .

documents.title: skinner suspended from commons for calling cameron 'dodgy ' and refusing to retract the term
text: labour 's dennis skinner asks if dodgy dave '' will explain what happened to a windfall he received john bercow , the speaker , asks skinner to withdraw the word dodgy '' .
( it is unparliamentary . )
skinner ignores bercow , and says he still refers to him as dodgy dave '' .
he tells the speaker : do what you like . ''
bercow says he is ordering skinner to leave the house for the remainder of the sitting .
skinner walks out .
labour 's dennis skinner suspended from commons for calling cameron 'dodgy ' and refusing to withdraw the term .
sir alan duncan , the conservative former international development minister , says cameron 's critics just hate people who are wealthy .
michael deacon ( @ michaelpdeacon ) sir alan duncan : if cameron 's critics are n't careful , we 'll end up with the house of commons `` stuffed with low-achievers ''

in the commons margaret hodge , the labour former chair of the commons accounts committee , asks if cameron will use his powers to order the crown dependencies and overseas dependencies to have public registers of beneficial ownership .
cameron says the uk government thinks that is the way to go .

but he says the government has been focusing on getting them to agree to three things : reporting information , a common system for collecting information and central registers of beneficial ownership .
all those have been agreed , he says .
jeremy corbyn had to pay a £ 100 fine for submitting his tax return late , the telegraph 's christopher hope reports .
christopher hope ( @ christopherhope ) breaking jeremy corbyn paid a £ 100 fine for submitting his tax return a week after the jan 31 deadline , his spokesman has confirmed .
here is the guardian 's matthew d'ancona on the opening exchanges .
matthew d'ancona ( @ matthewdancona ) cameron back on front foot .
but corbyn has nailed the key point : perception that we have been ripped off by the super-rich '' # camerontaxes
andrew tyrie , the conservative mp who chairs the commons treasury committee , says the only thing cameron did wrong was to criticise jimmy carr .
cameron says that , to be fair to jimmy carr , as soon as he realised he was involved in an aggressive tax avoidance scheme , he withdrew from it .
cameron appears to withdraw his criticism of jimmy carr over his tax arrangements .
a pdf with a 10-page photocopy of jeremy corbyn 's tax return has now landed in journalists ' inboxes .
sebastian payne ( @ sebastianepayne ) while cameron is speaking , jeremy corbyn 's tax return for the last year has landed - two key bits
cameron is responding to corbyn .
he says he joins corbyn in congratulating the journalists who broke this story .
cameron says corbyn accused him of distraction .
the biggest distraction today has been waiting for corbyn 's tax return , he says .
he says it was published at 3.35pm - after this session started , meaning people could not scrutinise it .
he says he provided the parliamentary commissioner for standards with information about his shares before the commissioner had even got the labour complaint .
he says he sold his blairmore shares in january 2010 , and the others in june .
he says he sat down with his permanent secretary and went through all his interests , including his friends .

he says he wrote to the eu asking for offshore trusts to be excluded from the transparency crackdown because the strong advice he received was that , if he did try to include them , there would be no international deal .
he says , if labour are questioning the integrity of hm revenue and customs , who will be carrying out the panama papers , they should not be doing so .
he says labour is wrong to say the uk government can just force offshore tax havens to act .
corbyn seems to be an opposition leader who wants argentina to have the falklands and the uk to invade gibraltar , he says .
he says today we have seen labour 's views on inheritance tax .
they would stop people leaving money to their children .
they are the enemies of aspiration .
corbyn asks cameron if he realises why people are so angry .
we have gone through six years of austerity , he says .
people are fed up .
they want real justice .
corbyn is on his fourth question .
why does cameron oppose putting uk tax havens on a blacklist ?
corbyn says last june treasury officials lobbied brussels not to take action against bermuda as a tax haven .
it is a tax haven favoured by google , he says .
he says tory meps have been told on six occasions to vote against moves to crack down on tax evasion .
across the country there is a thirst for action on global tax avoidance scams '' .
they undermine trust in public life .
they must be ended .
corbyn says the facilitating tax evasion law was announced by danny alexander a year ago .
( see 3.22pm . )
he says the tax taskforce set up by cameron will be neither independent nor credible .
will cameron back an independent inquiry into the panama papers information ?
corbyn says since 2010 there have only been 11 prosecutions for overseas tax evasion .
will resources for hmrc be increased ?
he says we need to ensure that trust is restored in our politics .
cameron has attacked tax evasion as immoral .
but he failed to give a full account of his own involvement until this week .
and he failed to take essential action to improve the system .
jeremy corbyn is responding to cameron .
he says cameron 's statement was a masterclass in the art of distraction '' .
cameron does not appreciate how angry people are about the perception there is noe rule for the rich , and another for everyone else .
he has six questions for cameron .
first , why did he not register his offshore profit in the register of members ' interests ?
second , when did he sell his blairmore investment in 2010 ?
and was any of the other £ 72,000 shareholding he sold offshore ?
corbyn says the ministerial code says ministers must declare anything that creates the perception of a conflict of interest .
so did cameron declare his offshore interests .
in 2013 cameron wrote to the president of the european council opposing a central register of beneficial ownership of offshore trusts .
does cameron still oppose this ?
corbyn says more than half of the firms involve in mossack fonseca were british .
that is a scandal , he says .

documents.title: tax havens have signed up to information-sharing measures , cameron says
text: cameron says he has three extra measures to announce .
first , he says crown dependencies and overseas territories have already agreed to exchange some tax information .
but today he can say they will all provide uk law enforcement officers with information about the beneficial ownership of companies .
cameron says most crown dependencies and overseas territories have agreed to provide uk law enforcement authorities with information about beneficial ownership .
only guernsey and anguilla have not yet signed up , but they are expected to soon , he says .
and he confirms the government will introduce the new law about facilitating tax evasion .
turning to tax evasion and tax avoidance generally , he lists some of the measures taken by his government .
no government has done more on this issue , he says .
he says 129 jurisdictions have committed to implementing a new international standard for reporting tax information .
this summer britain will become the first country in the g20 to set up a register of beneficial ownership , he says .
cameron says there is nothing wrong with people wanting to give money to their children .

documents.title: cameron says allegations about his father have been deeply hurtful and profoundly untrue ''
text: cameron turns to the allegations about his father 's offshore investment fund .
he says the allegations made about his late father have been deeply hurtful and profoundly untrue '' .
cameron says allegations about his father have been deeply hurtful and profoundly untrue '' .
he says offshore investment funds like blairmore are an entirely standard practice '' .
he says organisations like the bbc , the guardian , the mirror group and islington council have offshore investment funds .
he says he accepts the criticism that he should have responded more quickly to what was said last week .
but was angry about the way his father was being traduced .
he is proud of what is father did , he says .
mossack fonseca data leak prime minister david cameron makes a statement to the house of commons over his personal finances after it emerged he had profited from an offshore fund .
press association photo .

documents.title: david cameron 's statement
text: david cameron starts by talking about his personal finances .
he summarises the information released yesterday , and says releasing this amount of information is unprecedented .
but he says he is not saying everyone should have to publish this .

there is a strong case for saying the prime minister , chancellor and their shadows should have to release this information because they are responsible for the nation 's finances , or want to be , he says .
but he says he is not in favour of getting all mps to have to publish their tax returns .
they are covered by the mps ' code of conduct .
and , if we went further , other public figures and people like journalists would have to publish their tax details .
cameron says he does not favour that .
he says that would be a very big change , and should only go ahead after a public debate , he says .
cameron says he does not favour getting all mps or public figures to publish their tax returns .
george osborne makes less money from renting out his home than david cameron .
but his dividend income alone would be enough to put him in the higher tax band .
update : martin mcdonald says that my point about osborne 's dividends and the higher rate is wrong .
i 'm sorry .
i was just trying to make a general point about how much osborne gets in dividend income , not provide a detailed tax analysis .
martin mcdonald ( @ marty mcd ) @ andrewsparrow dividend income alone would put him in higher div rate ( 32.5 % ) not higher rate generally .
tax would be £ 1750 after tax credit

documents.title: osborne publishes tax details
text: here are the key figures .
osborne 's tax details
george osborne has published some tax details .
they are here , on the treasury website .

my colleague anushka asthana says jeremy corbyn has at last found his tax return anushka asthana ( @ guardiananushka ) jeremy corbyn tax returns about to arrive imagine nervous advisors collective sigh

the bbc 's kamal ahmed says the proposal for companies to be made criminally liable if they facilitate tax evasion seems to be one originally announced by danny alexander , the lib dem chief secretary to the treasury , when the coalition was still in power in march 2015 .
kamal ahmed ( @ bbckamal ) so , pm on evasion is referring to @ twitterid announcement has gov enacted budget 2015 avoidance measures ?
among the many articles published on david cameron 's tax affairs here are two that are particularly good .
jeremy cliffe at the economist 's bagehot blog says it is hard to know whether the new transparency david cameron is introducing will have a positive or negative impact overall .
quite where this transparency bidding war ends up depends on how the news cycle develops this week .
the story should eventually blow over , especially if the prime minister 's opponents ultimately have no misdemeanour to pin on him , as seems to be the case .
but it may mark the beginning of a newly intrusive climate in which the electorate is deemed to have a right to know all about its legislators ' dough .

a debate remains to be had about whether that is positive ( cleaning up politics and giving voters more power ) or negative ( enshrining a cynical presumption of wrong-doing and thus putting off prospective politicians ) .
nonetheless , events to date have already served as a reminder of two things .
the first is that anti-establishment feeling , among the politically active at least ( admittedly a huge caveat ) , is running high .
in other times , mr cameron 's reticent reaction to the story about his father might have been the end of the matter .

yet today it was pounced on by the prime minister 's rivals on both the left , in the labour party , and the right , on the eurosceptic wing of the conservative party , whose residual loyalty to the prime minister for winning last year 's election has been drained by his pro-eu campaigning over the past weeks .
helen lewis at the new statesman considers why cameron 's involvement in an offshore trust has become such a big story now , and argues his departure would not necessarily be good for the left .
not that lefties should rejoice wholeheartedly at the thought of cameron 's resignation - which socialist worker banners were calling for outside downing street on saturday .
in the run-up to the 1992 election , replacing the polarising figure of margaret thatcher with the relatively new face of john major is partially credited with preventing a tory defeat .
labour 's strategy for returning to office relies on pointing out the record of the conservatives in power , and contrasting that with their own projected credibility as an alternative .
that is easier against david cameron and geoge osborne than it would be against , say , boris johnson or nicky morgan .
a new leader might be able to leap free of the unpopular decisions made by the government , and leave the opposition struggling to frame a counter-argument .
if you think the idea of left-wingers feeling reservations about calling for a tory prime minister to resign is warping your brain , well - welcome to my world .
that 's how i 've felt all week .
i believe strongly that tax avoidance and other perfectly legal dodges are corrosive to our trust in political and economic institutions , and they should be exposed and condemned .
but it is hard to join a hue and cry against cameron 's tax arrangements led by people who clearly did n't think it was a story in 2012 .
earlier i quoted what the tax barrister graham aaronson said on the today programme about why he thought that david cameron 's mother was not engaged in tax avoidance when she gave him £ 200,000 .
another tax barrister , the pro-labour jolyon maugham , takes the opposite view , arguing that it was in a meaningful sense '' tax avoidance .
he explains why here , on his blog .

documents.title: pickles mocks corbyn for not being able to find his tax return
text: sir eric pickles , the conservative former communities secretary , was on the world at one in his capacity as the government 's anti-corruption tsar .
here are the key points he made .
pickles said there was nothing wrong with holding money offshore .

i do n't think there 's anything wrong in holding money offshore providing it 's properly declared , providing the authorities know it , providing the company 's registered with hm revenues and customs , which is , of course , the case .
you and i we 've probably got isas , we 've got pension schemes , it 's almost certain those isas and those pension schemes are invested in offshore companies .
he said the plan to make companies criminally liable if they fail to stop their staff facilitating tax evasion was due to be announced anyway .

we have consulted on this , if it 's been moved forward , it 's been moved forward only by a matter of a few months , consultation is complete and it will mean that those people who facilitate tax evasion - and often there are some very unpleasant schemes , particularly those that are engaged in money laundering - banks will have to , and financial institutions will have to operate a degree of due diligence and make sure this does n't happen .
he mocked jeremy corbyn for not being able to find his tax return .
it 's been quite a passage of time and i think it 's very ironic from the labour party that their leader seems to have lost his tax return in some drawer somewhere and no one can find it .
i think really we are beginning to arrive at a point where this is just prurience rather than seeking the facts and the truth .
he said he could not see the purpose of making all mps publish their tax returns .
but there might be a case for changing the rules on what mps have to include in the register of members ' interests so that they have to declare more about their investments , he said .
he rejected claims that cameron 's wealth was a political problem for him .
to tell you the truth , i always thought david had a bob or two and the same applied to george so i 'm not particularly surprised that they are wealthy .
i do n't envy anybody that is successful ; i once memorably said about the prime minister that we should n't look down on someone just because they went to eton .

he 's been a very effective prime minister , george has been a very effective chancellor - the fact they have a couple of bob between them i do n't think has any way affected their effectiveness in government .
i 've taken the quotes from politicshome .
sir eric pickles .
thomas/rex/shutterstock
the bbc 's laura kuenssberg says jeremy corbyn has an hour to find his tax statement , or else risk becoming the butt of a david cameron joke .
laura kuenssberg ( @ bbclaurak ) hour until cameron 's tax statement in commons , an hour for corbyn to find his tax return or else pm has easy comeback to almost any labour q
sajid javid , the business secretary , is addressing a meeting organised by the all-party parliamentary group on steel .
my colleague anushka asthana has some details .
anushka asthana ( @ guardiananushka ) sajid javid meeting appg on steel .

he 's confirmed that the govt will not support `` wholesale change '' of eu rules that prevent higher tariffs anushka asthana ( @ guardiananushka ) room filled with steelworkers and union folk too i 'm told he is being `` sheepish and attempting to be conciliatory '' anushka asthana ( @ guardiananushka ) javid has sd `` we do n't want to have a big debate in europe about rewriting the rule book '' .
soubry sys other countries also do n't want change anushka asthana ( @ guardiananushka ) javid getting a `` select committee grilling ''

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: downing street has signalled that george osborne , the chancellor , will publish information about his tax returns .
the prime minister 's spokeswoman made the surprise announce at the number 10 lobby briefing after the treasury played down the prospect of this happening .
the spokeswoman said david cameron thought that prime ministers , potential prime ministers , chancellors and shadow chancellors should publish this information .
cameron will make a statement about tackling tax evasion in the commons at 3.30pm and he will answer questions about his own finances .
jeremy corbyn will respond for labour , but he faces some embarrassment because it has emerged he has not been able to publish his own tax return yet because he does not have a copy of it .
number 10 has confirmed that the government will start sending out its controversial pro-eu leaflet to all homes in england today .
the same leaflet wil go to homes in scotland , wales and northern ireland leaflet after the may elections .
ken livingstone , the labour former london mayor , has rejected a report claiming corbyn 's office is trying to stop him giving tv and radio interviews .
commenting on the story , he told lbc : if jeremy thought i was damaging the labour party , he 'd up the phone and say 'ken , i 'd just like you to disappear for a bit ' and i 'd say fine .
jeremy has been a friend of mine for 45 years and i will do anything to get him elected .
what you would n't have is him having someone brief the press telling them that they are going to do this .
it 's just giving them another story .
people just make this stuff up .
david mcnarry , ukip 's northern ireland leader has said he would deport foreign doctors even if they were only found guilty of a parking infringement .

tata steel has agreed the sale of its uk long products business to investment group greybull capital for a nominal '' fee in a deal that will revive the british steel brand and could save 4,400 jobs .

as rob davies and gwyn topham report , the deal will save a steelworks in scunthorpe , two mills in teesside , an engineering workshop in workington , a design consultancy in york , and associated distribution facilities , as well as a mill in northern france .
boris johnson , the conservative mp and london mayor , has said he is willing to publish his tax returns .
he told the bbc : i have done it before .
i am very happy to ask my accountant to do it again .
we will put all the stuff out there .
there is nothing to hide in all this .
boris johnson ireland/ap
labour 's deputy leader tom watson told radio wm in the west midland this morning that , whatever david cameron says today , he will forever be remembered as the tax-dodging prime minister '' .
he also suggested that cameron could be out of office by the end of the year .
watson told the programme : whatever reforms david cameron proposes today , the damage is already done .
for every day of his remaining months as prime minister david cameron will be known as the tax-dodging prime minister .

documents.title: john mcdonnell says cameron should publish more detail about his finances
text: and here are more lines from john mcdonnell , the shadow chancellor 's , interview with bbc news .
mcdonnell said david cameron should publish information about his tax returns covering his time as opposition leader , not just his time as prime minister .
he said that if cameron refused to answer questions about finances before 2009 , the questions would not go away .
the problem with that is if you do n't answer those questions , they just keep coming back .
every day now we 've had a different statement from no 10 - we had six last week - and people just lose confidence and trust if you 're not straight .
what i said last week to the prime minister publicly was look , just give a straight answer straightaway and people will accept it then you can move on .

but the way in which you prevaricate and obfuscate in this way , it just arouses sus and it undermines trust and confidence - not just in him but in the processes he 's now putting forward to tackle tax abuse and tax evasion .
he said the inquiry being announced by cameron today into the panama papers was flawed because it was not independent .

my worry today is that the prime minister is bringing forward an inquiry into panama , which we 've urged to happen , but also what we 're saying is that inquiry is n't public and it is n't independent .
it 's reporting to the chancellor and home secretary and they 're both members of a party whose donors are implicated in this scandal .
he said that he favoured transparency '' in relation to mps having to publish their tax returns .
mcdonnell publishes his .
as for other mps having to do the same , he said in principle he was in favour - i prefer openness and transparency '' - but that there needed to be a wider debate on this .
john mcdonnell armstead/rex/shutterstock

documents.title: corbyn has not been able to publish his tax return yet because he does not have a copy
text: jeremy corbyn has promised to publish his own tax return .
but there has been a hold-up - because he does not have a copy .
according to labour , mps have to submit their tax returns by paper and corbyn sent his only copy to hm revenue and customs .
john mcdonnell , the shadow chancellor , told bbc news : he does his own tax returns , i believe .
he submitted [ it ] and i think he 's trying to get it back from hmrc .

documents.title: cameron , osborne and tax returns - what 's going on ?
text: one of the features of the relationship between david cameron and george osborne is that they are the first prime minister and chancellor who have not ended up falling out badly since - well , probably since callaghan and healey .
at least , they are so far .

and yet today we had a briefing from number 10 that sounded a bit like an attempt to bounce '' george osborne into publishing his tax returns - something that the treasury were implying yesterday he had no plans to do .
so what 's going on ?

there are at least three possible explanations : 1 ) that osborne did not want to release this information , but that he has been ordered to by cameron ; 2 ) that osborne was reluctant , but has been persuaded by cameron ; 3 ) that osborne and cameron jointly agreed this was a necessary step , but that it was decided to let the announcement come from number 10 , not from the treasury , to boost cameron 's authority .
treasury sources reject the suggestion that their line has changed in the last 24 hours .
what number 10 is saying now is consistent with what we were saying yesterday , a source told me .
it is certainly true that the treasury was not ruling out osborne publishing his tax return information yesterday .
but reporters certainly got the impression they were playing down the prospects of this happening .
at this point i have no further insight into what went on behind closed doors this morning , but a mixture of theories 2 ) and 3 ) may provide the most plausible explanation .

documents.title: no 10 lobby briefing - summary
text: here are the main points from the number 10 lobby briefing covering tax etc .
downing street signalled that david cameron has decided that george osborne should publish information about his tax returns .
yesterday the treasury was saying osborne had no plans to do this .
this morning sources said osborne was considering it , but that a final decision had not been taken .
no 10 indicated that osborne was present at this morning 's regular 8.30am downing street strategy meeting , and it seems a decision was taken then that osborne would release this material .
the prime minster 's spokewoman said : the prime minister has made it clear that he was willing to be transparent .
that is right for potential prime ministers also .
with regard to those in charge of the nation 's finances , the prime minister takes that the view that chancellors and shadow chancellors should show transparency .

asked why cameron was only recommending this for prime ministers and chancellors , and not for other treasury ministers , the spokeswoman said : they are the first and second lords of the treasury . ''
the spokeswoman would not comment on what conversations cameron may have had with osborne about this .

and asked whether osborne would publish this information before wednesday , when he is due to fly to washington for a g7 finance ministers ' meeting , she said decisions have not yet been taking about timing .
the spokeswoman refused to say whether or not any of the shares worth £ 70,000 sold just before he became prime minister were held offshore .
number 10 has revealed that cameron sold these in 2010 , at the same time he sold his shares in blairmore holdings , his late father 's offshore company .
but downing street has refused to say what these shares were .

the spokeswoman said cameron decided to sell his shares , rather than place them in a blind trust , because he felt that was the cleanest way '' to deal with the potential conflict of issues problem .
the spokeswoman said that cameron was neutral on the issue of whether other cabinet ministers , or mps , should also publish their tax return information .
asked about this , she replied : it is for people to make up their own minds .
naturally there will be a debate on this .
the spokeswoman dismissed suggestions that cameron should have to publish tax return information for the period when he was a potential prime minister ( ie , for 2005 and 2010 . )
asked why he was not releasing information for this period , the spokeswoman said the point was that he was prime minister now .
she also said he had had released an unprecedented amount of tax information for a british prime minister '' .
the spokeswoman defended cameron 's decision to publish just a summary of his tax return information , not the full document , saying this made it clear and simple for people to see '' .
the spokeswoman was unable to say why cameron 's tax return information did not contain any information about charitable giving , as tax returns normally do .
she said she would clarify this later .
and the spokeswoman was unable to explain why cameron 's tax return statement shows that the amount he received in interest fell from almost £ 7,000 in 2013-14 to £ 3,000 in 2014-15 .
she said she would clarify later .
the spokeswoman said cameron was happy '' for the parliamentary commission for standards to investigate his compliance with the mps ' code of conduct .
cameron believes he complied fully '' with its rules about registering interests , she said .
the spokeswoman defended current inheritance tax rules .

the prime minister is firmly of the view that we should support people in this country who want to work hard and save , build a life for their family and then be able to pass that on to their children .
that is about aspiration and wealth creation and it 's something this government is firmly behind .
the spokeswoman rejected claims that cameron 's decision to lobby the european union to exempt offshore trusts from a crackdown on tax avoidance amounted to hypocrisy .
this was one of the accusations levelled against cameron last week .
but the spokeswoman said that cameron had not tried to hide his lobbying effort ; the relevant letter is still published on the government 's website .
and she said cameron was concerned at the time to focus on making progress on ensuring that beneficial ownership rules cover companies .
and she said that around the world cameron was seen as someone who has led the way '' in terms of pushing the agenda for tackling tax evasion and aggressive tax avoidance .
the spokeswoman was unable to say whether blairmore would have been protected as a result of the exemption secured by the prime minister .
the spokeswoman indicated that cameron will take questions about his own tax affairs when he makes his commons statement at 3.30pm .

the statement will focus on government policy in relation to tax havens , and conceivably cameron could try to deflect questions about his tax affairs by saying he released all the relevant information at the weekend .
10 downing street nicholls/reuters

documents.title: no 10 says osborne should publish tax return information
text: i 'm just back from the number 10 lobby briefing .
the top line is that david cameron is saying george osborne should publish details of his tax returns .
the prime minster 's spokewoman said : the prime minister has made it clear that he was willing to be transparent .
that is right for potential prime ministers also .
with regard to those in charge of the nation 's finances , the prime minister takes that the view that chancellors and shadow chancellors should show transparency .
yesterday , as i reported earlier , the treasury was saying osborne had no plans to publish his tax returns .
this morning sources were saying he was considering it .
( see 8.58am . )
now the decision seems to have been taken , because there is no suggestion that osborne is going to defy cameron and refuse to disclose this information .
i will post a full summary shortly .
on the today programme jacob rees-mogg , the tory mp , said that tax avoidance covered things like buying duty free , and that it was totally legal .

in an earlier interview on the programme graham aaronson , a leading tax barrister who has chaired two government committees looking at tax avoidance , said that this was wrong , and that tax avoidance has a much narrower definition .
it may be helpful just to stand back and say what do we mean by tax avoidance .
as you have just said , of course we are dealing with transactions that are completely legal .
that is n't the issue .
the issue , when one talks about tax avoidance , is whether something , although legal , is dodgy , a bit smelly .
what 's the criterion to test this ?

both the committees that i have chaired , and the highest court in the land , have adopted a very simple working principle that a course of conduct that is entirely legal but is contrary to what parliament would have expected taxpayers to do , that can be described as tax avoidance ; something that parliament did not intend its legislation to be used in that way .
aaronson said that it was wrong to describe david cameron 's mother 's decision to sidestep inheritance tax by giving her son £ 200,000 as tax avoidance .
when you test what has happened with the camerons so far as inheritance tax and this gift is concerned , there is only one possible way of describing it .
it is not in the slightest dodgy .
this is just simply white .
aaronson said he particularly objected to headlines , like yesterday 's in the mail on sunday , describing this as a dodge .
neil henderson ( @ hendopolis ) mail on sunday : cameron tax bill dodge on mother 's 200k gift # tomorrowspaperstoday # bbcpapers i 'm off to the number 10 lobby briefing .
i will post again after 11.30am .
according to lucy fisher in the times ( paywall ) , some conservative mps are unhappy about david cameron 's decision to publish information about his tax returns .
here 's an extract from her story .
one tory mp said that the prime minister had been a clot '' in his handling of the row and had gone a bit too far '' in agreeing to publish his tax details , which would have a domino effect .

predicting that mr osborne would have to succumb to public pressure to do the same , the source said : the fact is , dave has put him in this position '' a second senior conservative mp also said of the disclosure that it would be difficult now the prime minister 's done it for others in the cabinet not to have to do it '' , but added that it was regrettable .
it extends its reach to all those in public life and the key question is : where does it stop ?
bbc journalists , councillors , judges ? ''
other tory parliamentarians felt it was too early to tell '' whether other cabinet members would be bounced into releasing their personal finances by public demand .
one said : george [ osborne ] has a case to not do so , because there 's no query about his financial affairs as there was with david cameron after the panama papers . ''
another added : i hope he resists , this has to stop somewhere . ''
there are three statements in the commons today .

as well as the statement from david cameron on tax evasion , we are getting a statement from david lidington , the europe minister , on the government 's pro-eu mass mailshot and from sajid javid , the business secretary on steel .

documents.title: jacob rees-mogg 's today interview
text: earlier i mentioned the conservative mp jacob rees-mogg 's surprising interview on the today programme .
( see 8.58am . )
here are the main points .
rees-mogg said that he thought all mps would end up publishing their tax returns .
asked if he would publish his , he replied : i think i 'm going to have to .
i think the mood has become once very clear , that all mps within a year or two will be publishing their returns and i 'm not going to be the one holed out against that .

the argument for doing so is that caesar 's wife must be above sus and that if you are managing the country 's affairs and voting on them , the electorate want to know that you 're doing it properly and independently .
he said politicians were to blame for the fact that they were having to surrender some of their privacy .
i think it 's a pity that we 've lost privacy , but to some extent its politicians ' fault because we lost the trust of the public as much as anything over the expenses affair .
he said david cameron did not get any tax advantages by investing in an offshore fund .
i 've managed and set up investment funds overseas .
they have no tax advantages for uk investors .
indeed , when i was first running them they were less advantageous .
if you put money into an open-ended investment company , or into a unit trust , you pay tax when you sell it and you pay tax on your income .

asked to explain why , then , people invested in these funds , he replied : the advantage is that they are usually for sophisticated investors , they are not on sale to retail investors , and they are therefore subject to a lesser level of regulation and restriction on what you can do .
so you can do more complex transactions .
but it is nothing to do with tax .
he said it was wrong to suggest that tax avoidance could be immoral .
david cameron should not have condemned legal tax avoidance by the commedian jimmy carr , he suggested .
we have to remember that tax evasion is illegal , but tax avoidance is not .
people are not supposed to arrange their tax affairs , as lord clyde famously said , to allow the inland revenue to put the largest shovel into their stores .
people are entitled to use legal means , such as buying duty free or isas or pension funds , not to pay more tax than required by law some , particularly on the left , elide evasion and avoidance .
that has been a great mistake and has confused people about the two .
evasion is illegal and people can go to prison for .
avoidance is , buy duty free .
there is no morality in this question at all .
it 's a question of what the law says .
if parliament ca n't pass proper laws that collect the right amount of tax , that 's the fault of parliament , not of the people obeying the tax law .
rees-mogg said there could be a case for changing the commons rules so that mps have to declare unearned income in the register of members ' interests .
at the moment they do not , he said .
but it would be perfectly reasonable '' to insist on this , he said .
jacob rees-mogg gardner/rex/shutterstock
nigel farage , the ukip leader , told itv 's good morning britain this morning that he thought david cameron had done absolutely nothing wrong at all '' .
as the telegraph reports , farage also said that he had set up a trust for his children some years ago - but had second thoughts and closed it .
i was advised to open a trust for my kids about 15 years ago i did and then i thought , you know , the world has changed , it does n't look right so i closed it .
nigel farage speaking at grassroots out ( go ) rally in glasgow last week lawson/pa
in the comments garymguk wanted to know whether number 10 published david cameron 's tax returns , or just a summary of the information they contained .
it was just a summary .
you can read it here , on the number 10 website .
michael gove , the justice secretary , told sky news that david cameron has behaved with integrity .

he said : i think that he has behaved entirely properly throughout and i think many of the criticisms - all of the criticisms really - that have been directed against him have been wrong , they are politically motivated .
i think that he has behaved with integrity .
one of the interesting features about david cameron 's tax plight is that he is not just coming under fire from the left .
over the last 48 hours he has started facing severe criticism , on very different grounds , from the right .
the left 's case against cameron is familiar .
if you have n't already , do read aditya chakrabortty 's column in today 's guardian , which sets out one version of it superbly .

the 1 % hide their money offshore - then use it to corrupt our democracy | aditya chakrabortty read more the right 's case against cameron is that he should be defending the right of people to minimise their tax liability more robustly .
the daily mail has devoted a full-page editorial to this today , and promoted its prominently on its front page .

neil henderson ( @ hendopolis ) mail : warning on 'uk muslim ghettoes ' # tomorrowspaperstoday # bbcpapers the mail editorial says that inheritance tax is unfair and that cameron should be defending the right of people to pay as little of it as possible .
but when his assailants froth with hysterical anger over every detail of his private finances enough of this madness .
instead of grovelling before the politics of envy mob , the prime minister should be arguing that , for most people , inheritance tax ( iht ) so , good for mr cameron 's mother !

if she wanted to give her son £ 200,000 after his father 's death , to top up his £ 300,000 inheritance , why on earth should she hand £ 70,000 to the treasury , when she was under no legal obligation whatsoever to do so ?
it also says that cameron is himself partly to blame for his own problems because of what he said about jimmy carr four years ago .
of course , one reason for his discomfort is that four years ago , he foolishly attacked the comedian jimmy carr as 'morally wrong ' for investing in a legally approved scheme to minimise tax .
thus , he blurred the distinction between tax avoidance ( which is legal ) and tax evasion ( which is a crime ) , while himself introducing the concept of morality into the equation .
to that extent , he is the author of his own troubles , hoist by his own petard .
dominic lawson here in the sunday times ( paywall ) and janet daley here in the sunday telegraph both made similar arguments yesterday .
uk politics is going through a remarkable transition .

there is probably no more conservative figure in the house of commons than jacob rees-mogg , no one more resistent to media-driven fads , no one more determined to stand up for the ancient rights of mps .
so we can guess what he thinks about the frenzy that has led to the prime minister publishing tax return information and other mps coming under pressure to do likewise .
he will be opposed , wo n't he ?
er , no .
on the today programme earlier rees-mogg ran up the white flag .
all mps would soon have to publish their tax returns , he said .
i think the mood has become one in which i think all mps within a year or two will be publishing their returns and i am not going to be the one holding out against that .
the argument for doing so is that caesar 's wife be above sus and that if you are managing the country 's affairs the electorate want to know that you are doing it properly and independently .
george osborne , the chancellor , has not published details of his tax return information , and yesterday the treasury indicated that he had no plans to do so .
overnight the line has changed and now treasury sources say osborne is considering publication .
but they stress that he has no offshore interests .
a treasury source said : we have been clear that the chancellor has never had any offshore shareholdings or other interests .
his income and interests are straightforward and declared publicly : his salary , rental income from a property in london and a shareholding in his father 's firm , osborne and little .
he is always happy to consider ways to ‎offer even more transparency .
this afternoon david cameron will be making a statement to mps about tax evasion and offshore funds .
it seems that he will also face questions about his own tax return .
it 's always dangerous to describe anything in the commons as unprecedented , but it is hard to think of anything like this happening before .
here is the guardian 's latest story on this .
cameron plans to introduce new crime of aiding tax evasion read more and here is the agenda for the day .
11am : number 10 lobby briefing .
around 3pm : peers begin a debate on the housing bill .
3.30pm : david cameron makes his statement to mps .

i will be focusing mainly on the cameron/tax story today but i will also be covering other breaking political news as it happens , as well as bringing you the best reaction , comment and analysis from the web .
i will post a summary at lunchtime ( probably ) and another in the afternoon .
if you want to follow me or contact me on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .
i try to monitor the comments btl but normally i find it impossible to read them all .
if you have a direct question , do include andrew '' in it somewhere and i 'm more likely to find it .
i do try to answer direct questions , although sometimes i miss them or do n't have time .
alternatively you could post a question to me on twitter .

if you think there are any voices that i 'm leaving out , particularly political figures or organisations giving alternative views of the stories i 'm covering , do please flag them up below the line ( include andrew '' in the post ) .
i ca n't promise to include everything , but i do try to be open to as wide a range of perspectives as possible .

5.13pm BST
17:13
Boris Johnson publishes details of tax returns going

4.21pm BST
16:21
Skinner suspended from Commons for calling Cameron 'dodgy' and refusing to retract the term

3.48pm BST
15:48
Tax havens have signed up to information-sharing measures, Cameron says

3.42pm BST
15:42
Cameron says allegations about his father have been “deeply hurtful and profoundly untrue”

3.01pm BST
15:01
Pickles mocks Corbyn for not being able to find his tax return

bulletin.text: Rolling coverage of all the day's political developments, including David Cameron's statement to the Commons about tax evasion, offshore funds and his own tax return.
Cameron says Osborne should publish tax return information.
